wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Solar System Portfolio project overview. Explain the project's unique concept of presenting a professional portfolio through an interactive solar system interface where each planet represents a different portfolio section. Document the project's purpose, key features including interactive navigation, smooth animations, responsive design, and premium dark space theme. Include the project's architecture overview, highlighting the layered approach with background, navigation, and content layers. Provide context about the target audience and use cases. Use terminology consistent with the codebase and include practical examples of the portfolio's visual impact.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for the Solar System Portfolio. Include detailed prerequisites covering Node.js requirements, development environment setup, and browser compatibility. Provide step-by-step installation instructions using npm, covering dependency installation, development server startup, and production build processes. Document the development workflow including local server access, hot reloading capabilities, and build optimization. Include troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues. Provide clear examples of commands and expected outputs. Address both manual setup and automated deployment options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed technology stack documentation for the Solar System Portfolio. Document the core technologies including React 19 as the primary framework, Vite 7 for build tooling and development server, and React Router DOM 7 for client-side navigation. Explain the role of each technology in the project architecture and why these specific versions were chosen. Document browser compatibility requirements, performance characteristics, and development tooling. Include information about the pure CSS approach without external libraries and the benefits this provides. Address version compatibility and upgrade considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture & Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Solar System Portfolio's component-based architecture. Describe the layered design approach with background layer (SpaceBackground), navigation layer (SolarSystem), and content layer (page components). Document the component hierarchy starting from App.jsx as the root component, explaining how components interact and communicate. Detail the design patterns used including component composition, animation-driven navigation, and layered presentation. Explain the separation of concerns between background systems, navigation mechanics, and content presentation. Include system context diagrams showing component relationships and data flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive component system documentation for the Solar System Portfolio's three core components. Document the SolarSystem component as the central navigation engine, including its orbital mechanics implementation, planet configuration system, and physics-based animation parameters. Detail the Planet component architecture with click handlers, orbital animations, and interactive behaviors. Explain the SpaceBackground component's canvas-based star field generation, performance optimizations, and visual effects. Include component props, state management, lifecycle methods, and inter-component communication patterns. Provide usage examples and customization options for each component.

wiki_catalogs.name: Portfolio Pages
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the five portfolio page components that represent different sections of the portfolio. Document the Home page structure and navigation guidance, Profile page content organization including personal information and experience, Skills page categorization system with technology tags, Projects page showcase with project descriptions and technology stacks, and Contact page layout with social links and professional information. Explain the content structure, styling approaches, and responsive design considerations for each page. Include guidelines for updating content and maintaining consistency across pages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling & Animation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive styling and animation documentation for the Solar System Portfolio's visual system. Document the CSS architecture including global styles, component-specific styling, and animation keyframes. Explain the dark space theme implementation, glassmorphic card designs, and responsive design strategy using media queries. Detail the animation system including orbital mechanics animations, hover effects, and canvas-based star field twinkling effects. Document CSS variable usage for theming, color customization options, and performance optimization techniques. Include guidelines for maintaining visual consistency and extending the styling system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Customization & Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive customization and deployment documentation for the Solar System Portfolio. Document the customization process including updating personal information across Profile, Skills, Projects, and Contact pages, adding custom profile photos, and modifying planet colors and orbital parameters. Explain the deployment process for Vercel, Netlify, and GitHub Pages, including build optimization and performance considerations. Detail the configuration options in vite.config.js and vercel.json, environment variables, and production build processes. Include troubleshooting guidance for common customization and deployment issues, along with best practices for maintaining the portfolio.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Solar System Portfolio: A Creative React Portfolio Project

## Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
This project is a unique portfolio website that presents a developer's professional profile in an innovative solar system-themed interface. The application combines traditional portfolio content with an interactive space-themed navigation system, creating an engaging user experience that reflects the developer's passion for technology and space exploration.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Innovative Navigation**: Replace conventional menu systems with an interactive solar system interface where each planet represents a different portfolio section
- **Visual Appeal**: Create an immersive space-themed experience using animated backgrounds and celestial mechanics
- **Professional Showcase**: Present skills, projects, and contact information in an organized, accessible manner
- **Modern Development**: Demonstrate contemporary React development practices with Vite bundler

### Target Audience
- Potential employers seeking to evaluate technical candidates
- Clients looking for creative developers
- Fellow developers interested in innovative UI patterns
- Anyone interested in modern web development approaches

## Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a hierarchical component structure built around three main layers:

```mermaid
graph TD
    App[App Component] --> SpaceBackground[SpaceBackground]
    App --> SolarSystem[SolarSystem]
    App --> ContentLayer[Content Layer]
    
    SolarSystem --> Sun[Sun Component]
    SolarSystem --> Orbit[Orbit Container]
    SolarSystem --> Planet[Planet Components]
    
    ContentLayer --> Routes[React Router]
    Routes --> Home[Home Page]
    Routes --> Profile[Profile Page]
    Routes --> Skills[Skills Page]
    Routes --> Projects[Projects Page]
    Routes --> Contact[Contact Page]
```

### Design Patterns

**1. Component Composition Pattern**
- Modular component architecture with clear separation of concerns
- Reusable components (Planet, SpaceBackground) with consistent APIs
- Hierarchical parent-child relationships for logical grouping

**2. Animation-Driven Navigation Pattern**
- CSS animations replace traditional hover effects
- Physics-based orbital mechanics for planet movement
- Interactive elements with visual feedback

**3. Canvas-Based Background Pattern**
- Hardware-accelerated star field rendering
- Dynamic star generation based on viewport dimensions
- Performance-optimized animation loops

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    Browser[Browser] --> React[React Runtime]
    React --> App[App Component]
    App --> SpaceBackground[SpaceBackground]
    App --> SolarSystem[SolarSystem]
    App --> Routes[React Router]
    
    SolarSystem --> Planet[Planet Components]
    Planet --> Router[React Router DOM]
    
    SpaceBackground --> Canvas[HTML5 Canvas]
    Routes --> Pages[Portfolio Pages]
```

### Data Flow

The application implements a unidirectional data flow pattern:

1. **Initialization**: Vite bootstraps React application
2. **State Management**: React Router manages navigation state
3. **Rendering**: Components render based on current route
4. **Interaction**: User clicks trigger navigation events
5. **Animation**: CSS animations handle visual transitions

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Application Bootstrap** (`src/main.jsx`)
- Initializes React application with strict mode enabled
- Wraps app in BrowserRouter for routing capabilities
- Sets up root rendering with modern JSX syntax

**Application Root** (`src/App.jsx`)
- Central component orchestrating all sub-components
- Implements layered architecture with z-index management
- Integrates space background, solar system, and content layers

### Core Modules

**Solar System Engine** (`src/components/SolarSystem.jsx`)
- Manages orbital mechanics for five distinct planets
- Implements physics-based animation with configurable parameters
- Handles responsive design across multiple screen sizes
- Provides fallback mechanisms for asset loading failures

**Interactive Navigation** (`src/components/Planet.jsx`)
- Individual planet components with click handlers
- CSS animation integration for orbital motion
- Dynamic styling based on configuration parameters
- Event delegation for smooth navigation experience

**Immersive Background** (`src/components/SpaceBackground.jsx`)
- Canvas-based star field generation
- Real-time animation with twinkling star effects
- Responsive canvas sizing with window resize handling
- Optimized animation frame management

### Configuration Approach

**Build Configuration** (`vite.config.js`)
- React plugin integration for JSX transformation
- Modern ES module support
- Development server optimization

**Package Dependencies** (`package.json`)
- React 19.2.4 with concurrent features
- React Router DOM 7.13.0 for client-side routing
- Vite 7.3.1 for modern build tooling
- @vitejs/plugin-react for optimized React development

### External Dependencies

Key dependencies include:
- **React & React DOM**: Core library and DOM renderer
- **React Router DOM**: Client-side routing implementation
- **Vite**: Next-generation build tool with fast HMR
- **@vitejs/plugin-react**: Optimized React JSX processing

### Integration Points

**Canvas API Integration** (`src/components/SpaceBackground.jsx`)
- Direct manipulation of HTML5 Canvas context
- requestAnimationFrame for smooth animations
- Performance monitoring and cleanup

**CSS Animation Integration** (`src/components/SolarSystem.css`)
- Keyframe animations for orbital mechanics
- CSS custom properties for dynamic styling
- Responsive breakpoint management

### Component Relationship Diagrams

```mermaid
graph LR
    App --> SpaceBackground
    App --> SolarSystem
    App --> ContentLayer
    
    SolarSystem --> Sun
    SolarSystem --> Orbit1[Orbit 1]
    SolarSystem --> Orbit2[Orbit 2]
    SolarSystem --> Orbit3[Orbit 3]
    SolarSystem --> Orbit4[Orbit 4]
    
    Orbit1 --> Planet1[Planet 1]
    Orbit2 --> Planet2[Planet 2]
    Orbit3 --> Planet3[Planet 3]
    Orbit4 --> Planet4[Planet 4]
    
    ContentLayer --> Home
    ContentLayer --> Profile
    ContentLayer --> Skills
    ContentLayer --> Projects
    ContentLayer --> Contact
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**1. Interactive Solar System Navigation**
- Five celestial bodies representing portfolio sections
- Physics-based orbital animations with adjustable parameters
- Visual feedback through hover and click interactions
- Responsive design adapting to different screen sizes

**2. Immersive Space Environment**
- Star field generated with realistic twinkling effects
- Dynamic canvas rendering optimized for performance
- Smooth animations using requestAnimationFrame
- Adaptive star density based on viewport size

**3. Professional Portfolio Sections**
- Home page with introduction and navigation guidance
- Detailed profile section with education and experience
- Skills showcase with categorized expertise
- Projects gallery with descriptions and technologies
- Contact form with professional information

### Implementation Highlights

**Performance Optimization** (`src/components/SpaceBackground.jsx`)
- Efficient canvas clearing and redraw cycles
- Star count calculation based on viewport area
- Animation frame cleanup and event listener management
- Memory optimization through proper resource disposal

**Responsive Design** (`src/components/SolarSystem.css`)
- Multi-tiered media queries for different device sizes
- Flexible orbital scaling maintaining proportional relationships
- Touch-friendly interaction areas for mobile devices
- Adaptive typography and spacing adjustments

**Accessibility Features**
- Semantic HTML structure in page components
- Proper contrast ratios in space-themed color schemes
- Keyboard navigation support through React Router
- Screen reader friendly content organization

### Feature Architecture Diagrams

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Loading
    Loading --> SpaceBackground: Canvas Ready
    SpaceBackground --> SolarSystem: Stars Generated
    SolarSystem --> Home: Default Route
    Home --> Profile: Planet Click
    Profile --> Skills: Planet Click
    Skills --> Projects: Planet Click
    Projects --> Contact: Planet Click
    Contact --> Home: Planet Click
    Home --> Loading: Page Refresh
```

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [vite.config.js](vite.config.js)
- [main.jsx](src/main.jsx)
- [App.jsx](src/App.jsx)
- [SolarSystem.jsx](src/components/SolarSystem.jsx)
- [Planet.jsx](src/components/Planet.jsx)
- [SpaceBackground.jsx](src/components/SpaceBackground.jsx)
- [SolarSystem.css](src/components/SolarSystem.css)
- [App.css](src/App.css)
- [Home.jsx](src/pages/Home.jsx)
- [Profile.jsx](src/pages/Profile.jsx)
- [index.html](index.html)

</blog>
